duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise, train, and oversee Receiving, Assembly, and Shipping Inspection department procedures and processes.
Ensure compliance with ISO 13485, FDA, and other regulatory requirements for medical device and other regulated product manufacturing.
Monitor equipment calibration and maintain records to ensure compliance with quality and regulatory standards.
Collaborate with Account Teams to meet customer quality requirements and exceed expectations.
Stop processes or shipments to address nonconformance issues and ensure proper identification and control of non-conforming products.
Participate in quality systems maintenance, training, and team involvement as required.
Analyze and resolve customer quality concerns in collaboration with Operations Manager.
Conduct defect analysis from In Process and Final Inspection data to enhance continuous improvement processes.
Comply with facility safety, work rules, security requirements, and accident/incident procedures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Quality Control, Industrial Engineering, or a related field (Master's preferred)
